Reviews.Title: “Nasty but Legendary”
Reviews.Author: herbmalsmanvisions
Reviews.Content: My date(s) of stay were much earlier than June of 2007. I actually stayed there in 1999, and again in 2000. In those days, hanging on the wall in the lobby, were a series of b&w photos...circa 1912. The photos featured primarily, seaman. They had just arrived in Manhattan. They were some of the survivors of the Titanic tragedy. Atop the building, in that era, was a searchlight. The same searchlight that is mentioned in the accounts of the survivors, as they sailed into the city. Many of those seaman stayed at the hotel, At the time...it was exclusively maritime housing, I believe. Lying in bed, in that little room, as, uninviting as it was...I felt a special kinship with those survivors. If it served their purpose...it served mine, as well. The last time I was there, the photographs had been removed. The searchlight was dismantled a long time ago.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have EVER stayed in”
Reviews.Author: ash007London
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. Unless@ - you like drug-addicted prostitutes and drug dealers on your doorstep - the worst sized and poorest quality rooms you will ever experience - the fear of death being overwhelming I could go on but what's the point? read some of the reviews here and you will know I'm right...

Reviews.Title: “Budget but great location for vagrant spotting”
Reviews.Author: davidMcgovern
Reviews.Content: a proper grimey hotel. very cheap and you get what you pay for in NYC. great location and a fab area of new york. bring your own pillow or buy one for a couple of bucks and there are some great food places locally. not recomended for couples or the single woman as it is a bit rough in that part of town, druggies and hookers but all very entertaining and my room looked out to the statue of liberty and the road in front of the hotel which is guaranteed entertainment... not for the faint hearted or niave. keep your wits about you but enjoy it...

Reviews.Title: “A Hint of Real New York”
Reviews.Author: Arts_Enthusiast
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at Hotel Riverview and it was everything I expected. Rooms were tiny but cheap. Location is amazing. The hotel still has a hint of old-time New York that welcomes the ones who don't belong to any other city. Amazing mixture of personalities from all walks of life.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: toca412
Reviews.Content: I never stayed at the Hotel Riverview but live in the neighborhood. Believe all the negative reviews. This place is downright scary. There are drug addicts and transgender prostitutes that frequent here. I always feel sorry for the unknowing tourists I see arriving outside this hotel. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “what a dump”
Reviews.Author: kellybabymunich
Reviews.Content: we had to buy thick blankets first to lie upon, because the place was so filthy and the scheets holeridden and disgusting. We had already paid for 3 nights, but checked out in the morning anyway(without a refund). My friend was bitten by bedbugs in his room, I was lucky. Pay a little bit more and stay somewhere else(anywhere).

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Bedbugs; No Additional Charge”
Reviews.Author: JOOB
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, New York doesn't offer much in the way of budget accomodations. Hotel Riverview is one of the few places you can crash for a reasonable price. You won't, however, feel as if you've received a bargain. Let me describe the experience for you. At the check-in desk you'll be treated either rudely or with indifference You'll have to speak up, as your voice has to carry through the bulletproof glass. The staff will be in no hurry to process the paperwork for your stay. Customs at JFK is quicker than this motley crew. Just smile as you are handed a paper-thin towel to shower with. Your "room" will be the size of a large closet. If you carry a large frame, be sure to step sideways into the closet, lest you get wedged between the bed and wall. Your closet will come equipped with a t.v. which may or may not provide a reception. You'll pray that it does, if only to drown out the endless incoherent ramblings of your next door neighbor, or should I say neighBOAR. If your television isn't working properly, fear not. Your neighbor's t.v. will be working fine. You'll be able to enjoy whatever he's listening to as the walls are paper thin. Another form of entertainment is only a few yards away, as two of the permanent "residents" will be having a heated arguement that may result in blood being spilled. After all this excitement you'll be ready for a good night's rest. Sleep soundly as the bedbugs nip at your body. Crack open your window to combat the sauna-like conditions in your closet. Come morning, it's time to hit the showers. You might have trouble finding one that doesn't have urine, feces, or wet toilet paper on the floor. You'll get plenty of exercise, climbing the stairs to other floors to find a shower that hasn't been violated. Upon leaving the "Hotel" Riverview, tears will be streaming down your face. These will be tears of joy, as you just survived one of the most miserable nights of your life and now realize the nightmare is over.

Reviews.Title: “feces on the bathroom floor, scary local tenant with hideous glares...”
Reviews.Author: travelingrocket
Reviews.Content: feces on the bathroom floor, scary local tenant with hideous glares...and thats just the beginning. Coming from Europe, female and a grad student, I called the hotel beforehand and booked my room and regreted it painfully. A very scary place to return to after a night out --even scary to leave in the mornings with your stuff still in it. Sure, the locale gets going for this nightmarish hellhole and sure you can push your miserably narrow bed against the thin door and hope none of the local occupants screamimg and fighting down the hall break into your room......

Reviews.Title: “dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: sunseasurf
Reviews.Content: Don't listen to the reviews that say it's charming or has character. It is skid row. If you feel inclined to drop 30 dollars here, I would suggest sleeping in nearby Hudson RIver Park under the stars for FREE. Even prisoners in the penitentiary get better treatment. At least then you won't have to share a dank room with NO view of the river with the ten cockroaches that will crawl across your face, or see the blood stains through your marginally clean cigarette stained sheet with holes in it, or journey down the hall in the morning after watching lines on the color tv that doesn't receive anything to take a shower where there is only one hook on the bloody door to hang up your clothes, which will undoubtedly fall on the wet floor of the community bathroom. No thanks. I would rather brave the streets of new york and spend my 30 bucks on a dinner. Use those 30 bucks to charm yourself with and sleep under the stars.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are TINY, yes, the Bathrooms are down the hall, yes, you will share the hotel with international travelers, bike messengers, and local characters, yes, most rooms have neither TV's nor phones, and YES, you are in the HEART of Greenwich Village, YES, you are spending your money on food, music, beer, shows, museums, and all that NYC has to offer and NOT on a place to SLEEP! If you want a great place to be with your EYES CLOSED, then this is not the place for you. But if you want to spend your money with your EYES OPEN, have have a clean cheap place to be WITH YOUR EYES CLOSED, then this IS the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, geat prices”
Reviews.Author: lestat992_11
Reviews.Content: This Hotel appears to be as an insiders tip. Where else you could sleep that cheap in New York than there (especially if you book one week)? The location ist just perfect. West Village means a save and calm neighbourhood. Close to Chelsea, trendy Meat District, etc. The hotel is clean, but don't expect Hilton***** standards, of course. Its its more like YMCA. Double rooms are quite spacious, but single rooms are definitely not! I have been staying there several times and always enjoyed it every time. Staff is not too friendly, but they do their work as expected - and enhance security. Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: robbieBoxx
Reviews.Content: First things first, don't stay here if your used to 3 or 4 star accomodation, even 2 star accomodation beats this but at the price i would say it the best value for money around. I've stayed here a number of times and have no problems with the place. The staff are friendly and helpful and security is good. The location is great, west village with excellent views of the Hudson river. If you're on a budget then check this place out

Reviews.Title: “terrifying, nightmarish, should be condemned”
Reviews.Author: fabgourmet
Reviews.Content: Ok, first let me say I'm a pretty young guy and I think I am a pretty laid back person. I have read a lot of reviews on here where the people freaked out about seeing a hair on the floor or having to wait 30 secs for some hot water and then give the hotel a 1 star rating and went on to rant and rave. That is not my style but I do have to say that this was a horrible, terrible experience. So bad, in fact, I am not even quite sure where to begin. Although I gathered enough... experiences (use the term loosely) here to write a novella, I will list only certain of the more egregious lowlights and affronts to normalcy which I encountered during my oh so long week at the Riverview. One morning I was awakened by a transgendered person of color collapsed but lucid in the stairwell screaming aggressively at the top of her lungs, "One-a y'all M.F.ers gonna help me up!!? Help!!!?" She didn't appear drunk, lord only knows what she had ingested to have so inhibited her so that she collapsed. Nobody helped her up, not even I and I am a compassionate soul, and she went on screaming for quite some time. This was a Sunday AM at maybe 9 am. The bathroom was absolutely positively disgusting, BRING SHOWER SHOES and I truly did not feel safe showering here, thank God I found one shower where the door actually locked, it is worth looking around at showers on different floors to find one which locks because otherwise I quite simply would be Euro for a day and skip the shower altogether. The showers were uniformly disgusting and looked as if they hadn't been cleaned in years and you'll want to have the shower over with as soon as possible anyway even if you do find a shower which locks. Also, the weather in mid-Feb. in NYC was surprisingly temparate yet they blasted the heat and my "room", half the size of a small closet (generously), was so hot that my chap-stick literally melted. This was far and away the least of my worrys here given what else I faced at this establishment. My skin also became dried out from the heat. It was so bad, in fact, that I began to sleep with the windows open but one day I forgot to close them and ran back to the hotel terrified that somebody had broken into my room through the screen beacuse most of the other "guests" here are homeless or transient and not tourists. If you are a normal person and not homeless or borderline homeless you will REALLY stick out and I am not a flashy dresser, in fact, in most places I wouldn't even stick out of a crowd at all. I felt so unsafe here that if somebody were hanging out in the hallway I walked past my room and waited for them to leave because I didn't want anybody knowing which room was mine. Looking back, I think this was a smart move and not overly paranoid at all. Also, the walls are paper thin and you can hear it if one person has their TV on 5 rooms up as if it is in your own room. I slept only with the benefit of earplugs. I later learned from a friend that on the weekends many people come here to rent a room to be intimate with a new friend or escort. Of course you can hear this as well. I don't think I would have gotten any sleep or survived the week without opening the window whenever I was in the room, earplugs and shower shoes, it would have just been too much. Also, it is an exaggeration to call this a room, it is more like the size of half of a closet. Unlike other reviewers I did not get bug bites from the sheets but I am not surprised to read that that occured here. It is a small miracle I was not harmed in any way and lost no property here. This was a scary, scary, scary place and undeserving of a one-star rating. There are no ratings for this hotel! Do yourself a favor for your health and security, beg a college friend to crash on their couch or look for a sublet or something on craigslist maybe. I cannot recommend this place for any reason under any circumstances. Abominable. Repellent. Repulsive.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed her in mid October. I thought how bad can it be since it was in a decent part of town. The outside isn't that bad looking. We went in and I had read a review that said this was a hangout for prostitutes and transvestites and that statement hit the nail on the head. There were a few that I saw. While checking in I had the pleasure of meeting the smelliest person in all of New York. The staff was rude and very slow. The elevator stops operating at 11 and you have to take stairs if you get back late. Sucks if your at the top. The room was tiny and a weird smell to it. The tv worked but not to well. The restrooms were filthy and had a horrible odor to them. We stayed out late as possible (good thing bars close at 4 instead of 2 like in LA). We got back to room and slept for a few hours and got the hell out there. My friend slept under the blankets and woke up with all kind of bug bites. The only good thing was that in morning there was a very nice view of the river. Never stay here not matter how cheap it is. You will regret it but if you do stay here i'm sure that you'll have some interesting stories.

Reviews.Title: “The place is a dump - AVOID!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is a dump. The rooms are tiny (about the size of a closet), don't have AC, and the TVs rarely get proper reception. The shared showers / toilets are filthy, and the staff is rude. Aside from being a rundown hangout for transvestite prostitutes and drug users, it is also used as an S.R.O. hotel by the city to place homeless people. There is little security, no room service, and a rarely working elevator. Safety and health are questionable. AVOID THIS HOTEL! Just pay an extra 20 bucks a night for a real hotel, it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A Place with Character”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Riverview is a great place! I've stayed there weeks at a time on several different occaisions. The place just has character.. Character of New York. I had an opera singer for a "room neighbor". I never had a problem with pesty people. They do their best to keep them away by charging for guests and locking the staircase to go upstairs. If you want a West VIllage/Chelsea New York experience, check it out and save a couple bucks!
